items.sentence: Tell me why you aren\'t planning on going to Boston with us.
Tom demonstrated the company\'s newest product to the crowd.
Tom told Mary that he wouldn\'t be doing anything dangerous.
Tom and Mary spent the day putting up Christmas decorations.
Tom arrived at Mary\'s house in the middle of the afternoon.
The church is still standing. Everything else was destroyed.
If I had had my way, we wouldn\'t be in this mess right now.
It would\'ve been better if you had gone to Boston with Tom.
It\'ll be easier for me to do since I have better equipment.
It\'s been three years since Tom graduated from high school.
It\'s going to be difficult for us to get this done by 2:30.
It\'s going to be difficult to find somebody to replace Tom.
How can we prevent something like this from happening again?
Tom couldn\'t rule out the possibility that he was mistaken.
Didn\'t you know Tom was planning to go to Boston with Mary?
I can\'t remember the words to the song you want me to sing.
Tom climbed up the ladder and picked an apple from the tree.
Tom could think of no reason why he needed to go home early.
Tom currently holds the school record for the 100 yard dash.
Would it really have made any difference if I\'d been there?
You wouldn\'t be in trouble if you had stayed away from Tom.
I can\'t believe that Tom just left without saying anything.
I can\'t remember the last time I had a meal this delicious.
I can\'t remember the last time I watched a basketball game.
This stew would taste better if you added some black pepper.
There\'s a rumor that Tom and Mary are going to get married.
There\'s no doubt in my mind that Tom was telling the truth.
These pictures could\'ve been taken at that time, I suppose.
Some people never seem to learn how to think for themselves.
Sooner or later, Tom will tell me everything I want to know.
I don\'t think we\'ll be hearing from Tom for quite a while.
Tom is the only one in our class who hasn\'t been to Boston.
I offered to help Tom, but he said he didn\'t need any help.
I really should\'ve told Tom why he was supposed to do that.
Tom admitted that he didn\'t do what we had asked him to do.
Tom and Mary decided to meet there again the following week.
I want to be certain that we\'re doing what\'s best for Tom.
I think it\'s unlikely Tom will get back in time for supper.
I can\'t be sure, but I think Tom wants to go out with Mary.
Tom was too busy worrying about Mary to worry about himself.
Tom couldn\'t say anything that would make Mary quit crying.
Tom cut the bright red ribbon with a pair of giant scissors.
I have no idea why Tom doesn\'t want to go to Mary\'s party.
What\'s the real reason Tom didn\'t want to go to the party?
Tom and Mary rented a house in Boston after getting married.
Tom listened to Mary recite the poem that she had memorized.
Tom was sitting on the edge of the desk playing his ukulele.
Tom was talking on the phone when Mary walked into the room.
Tom put on his fishing vest and hat and headed for the door.
Tom always checks the caller ID before he answers his phone.
